urls.title: Leeds Lit Fest
urls.description: Leeds Lit Fest 2023 is back! Join us from Saturday 25 Feb - Sunday 5 March. Returning for its fifth year, the city’s award-winning festival of words and thought will take place across a diverse range of the city’s spaces and aims to bring together, and help develop, the city’s literary scene, with writers, poets and performers from the UK and beyond. This year’s festival will tie in with Leeds 2023, the citywide celebration of culture and will interweave themes of untold stories, radical acts, playful adventures and future generations The festival which is organised by a number of cultural organisations in the city, will engage audiences in over 50 events aimed to appeal not just to lovers of books and the written word but also to appeal to audiences who would never normally consider going to a literature festival. This eclectic approach to the programme will see comedy, cabaret, a literature quiz, film screening, art exhibition, theatre performance, a literature walk and creative work

urls.title: Leyla Josephine at Chapel FM
urls.description: Winner of the Hammer and Tongue UK National Slam and numerous others, Leyla has shared the same bill as Kae Tempest, Hollie McNish and Lowkey. Tonight she performs blistering poems from her first collection In Public/In Private published by Burning Eye, supported by Leeds poets Pamela Crowe, Caitlin McKenna and Poppy Jennings.

urls.title: Tubthumping - Thurs 3 Nov @ The Constitutional - Nov 3 2022, 7:00PM
urls.description: £10 + Booking Fee. Doors 7pm. Show 8pm. A rip-roaring intro to some of the very best spoken word acts on the UK's thriving scene. This is poetry as you've never seen it before, presented by Maria Ferguson (Saboteur Award Winner) & Matt Abbott (Nymphs & Thugs, Skint & Demoralised). Featuring: JASMINE GARDOSI: Jasmine is a multiple slam champion, beatboxer, Birmingham Poet Laureate finalist, and winner of the Out-Spoken Prize for Poetry. Her work exploring identity, LGBTQ issues and mental health has appeared on Button Poetry, at the Tate Modern, Glastonbury Festival, across BBC Radio, and on Sky Arts’ BAFTA-winning show, Life & Rhymes. Her poetry/beatbox/Celtic dubstep show 'Dancing To Music You Hate' explores gender identity and was commissioned by Warwick Arts Centre. LOUISE FAZACKERLEY: Introducing poet-extraordinaire and theatre-maker, Louise Fazackerley! Coming to you fresh from the exotic Northern streets of Orwell’s Wigan. She tells darkly humorous stories of hope and hurt. With

urls.title: Quantum Sauce - Wed 26 Oct @ The Constitutional - Oct 26 2022, 7:00PM
urls.description: £5 + Booking Fee. Doors 7pm. Starts 8pm. SCIENCE + ART + BEER = MIND EXPANSION! This time, we explore themes inspired by Ink Slingers: Farsley Literature Festival. Three experts talk for 30 minutes each: Prof Tim Wright - "Rivers" of London, as spied from space... Dr Mark Sumner - Seams and Sustainability: unpicking the myths of the rag trade. Dr Jo Waugh and Dr Adam Smith - What have the satirists ever done for us?

tweets.text:
The newest city literature festival starts this week!
Not too late to get tickets for events at all these lovely Farsley venues... @TrumanBooks @OldWoollen @AmityBrewCo @FConstitutional and @leedslibraries
https://t.co/pKFsq5b399

urls.title: Ink Slingers - Farsley Literature Festival
urls.description: Ink Slingers is the first Farsley Literature Festival.  It’s brought to you by Truman Books and Trouble at Mill Events, supported by our friends at Sunny Bank Mills and Leeds Libraries. Both Truman Books and the new venue The Old Woollen are independent ventures that opened in the wake of the Covid pandemic.  Catching up on our reading kept us going through lockdown, but we were definitely ready to get together again in person and share our love for books and stories. Ink Slingers is the first Farsley Literature Festival.  It’s brought to you by Truman Books and Trouble at Mill Events, supported by our friends at Sunny Bank Mills and Leeds Libraries.

I loved walking round the Mills, beautiful place

urls.title: The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida | The Booker Prizes
urls.description: Shehan Karunatilaka’s second novel is a searing, mordantly funny satire set amid the murderous mayhem of a Sri Lanka beset by civil war.

urls.title: Short Story Writers! This is Your Last Chance to Apply to Join The Northern Short Story Festival's Academy. Submissions Close on Friday.
urls.description: The Northern Short Story Festival Academy is a development programme which helps short story writers to take their writing to the next level, and for the first time it is open to any writer who is based in the North of England. Perhaps you’ve published a few stories already, in print or online, or had stories placed or longlisted in competitions. If you’re serious about short story writing, aged 18+ and are resident in the North of England we want to hear from you! Participants will join a monthly

urls.title: Tubthumping - Thurs 29 Sept @ The Constitutional - Sep 29 2022, 7:00PM
urls.description: £10 + Booking Fee. Doors 7pm. Show 8pm. A rip-roaring intro to some of the very best spoken word acts on the UK's thriving scene. This is poetry as you've never seen it before, presented by Maria Ferguson (Saboteur Award Winner) & Matt Abbott (Nymphs & Thugs, Skint & Demoralised). Featuring: KEVIN P. GILDAY: Award-winning poet and performer Kevin P. Gilday is an award-winning poet, writer and performer from Glasgow. He is the founder of poetry performance collective The Scribbler's Union and was co-founder of much loved spoken word cabaret night Sonnet Youth. He is a National Theatre of Scotland Breakthrough Writer, a BBC Writersroom Scottish Voice and one of Scotland’s most celebrated contemporary poets. He has performed all over the world, from Hollywood to East Kilbride, including major festivals (BBC 6Music Festival, Glastonbury), Fringes (Edinburgh, Toronto, Vancouver) as well as large-scale tours of the UK, Germany, Canada, and the US. He has supported artists and public figures

urls.title: New Farsley Literature Festival aims to put village on literary map - West Leeds Dispatch
urls.description: By John Baron Bookworms rejoice! An independent bookstore owner is launching the inaugural Farsley Literature Festival to help put the village on the literary map. Amanda Truman is the driving force behind Ink Slingers, the first Farsley Literature Festival, which runs between Tuesday, October 18 and Tuesday, 22 November 2022. Amanda is the owner of […]

📢 We're hiring - Programmes & Partnerships Manager, Yorkshire! 📢

Play a key role in delivering First Story's Young Writers Programme & enable young people in Yorkshire to grow in confidence, creativity and writing craft. 

Find out more and apply: https://t.co/vpok6oQFyu https://t.co/cq3hEq48HC
@BigBookend @sunnybankmills Brilliant 👏 👏 👏  So glad you are pleased with your woven piece 🙂. I loved the blue stripe amongst the yellow yarns.💙💛

The new term has begun and I started on Saturday @sunnybankmills with Weaving in a Day. There was a wonderful group of participants that took part and each produced a beautiful piece of fabric.

All work produced by participants. https://t.co/XgNVumc2RJ

❤️We may never find the original, but beyond overjoyed to see David's blue plaque arrive - come and see it for yourself this Sunday @The_Tetley as we celebrate its reinstallation 🇳🇬 🇬🇧❤️🎙️🪕🥁🎶❤️https://t.co/gPPAA1eIAw https://t.co/xEoNXGNi9o

urls.title: Rescheduled: David Oluwale Blue Plaque installation | The Tetley
urls.description: The Tetley is a contemporary art gallery in the art deco headquarters of the former Tetley Brewery in central Leeds. Galleries, Bar & Kitchen, events!

tweets.text:
Celebrate the literature & culture of #Ukraine

Featuring Ukrainian writers @AKurkov, Iryna Shuvalova, Kateryna Babkina, alongside translators @BlackerUilleam and Nina Murray. Plus readings by #ItsASin actor Omari Douglas.

7 Sept, 7pm. @ReginaldCentre  https://t.co/P52OX1s7Fd https://t.co/uU0K8usf3N

urls.title: Live Screening: Worldwide Reading of Ukrainian Literature at The Reginald Centre Community Hub and Library
urls.description: Tickets are now available for Live Screening: Worldwide Reading of Ukrainian Literature at The Reginald Centre Community Hub and Library, Leeds on Wednesday 7th September 2022. Click the link for further information and to secure your tickets now!
